Class CExpressionEvaluator

java.lang.Object
CExpressionEvaluator
All Implemented Interfaces:
IExpressionEvaluator
public class CExpressionEvaluator
extends java.lang.Object
implements IExpressionEvaluator
This Class is used to change the infix expressions to postfix expressions using infixToPostfix function String infix expression String postfix expression The class is also used to evaluate the numeral postfix expressions using the evaluate fucntion String numeral postfix expression integer value representing the result of the postfix expression and if the result if float it is casted to integer

    Checks whether the postfix expression contains only one positive number or not
    private boolean checkOperators​(java.lang.String noNegative)

    Used to check whether the parenthesis are wrong constructed for example an opening parenthesis with no closing one and vice versa.
    private boolean checkParenthesisErrors​(java.lang.String noNegative)
    Checks whether there is an error with the parenthesis in the expression such as 5 ( (no operator between the parenthesis the number) and ) 5 (no operator between the parenthesis and the number).

    private boolean checkVariablesPF​(java.lang.String expression)
    Check whether the input postfix expression contains Variables or not such as A or B as these cannot be evaluated
    int evaluate​(java.lang.String expression)
    Evaluate a postfix numeric expression, with a single space separator it may throw RuntimeException if the input expression is null or if it is wrong-formed it may throw ArithmeticException if there is division by zero

      private boolean checkOperators​(java.lang.String noNegative)

      noNegative - An infix expression with no spaces and any negative number is converted to subtraction from zero (0 - )

    • infixToPostfix

      public java.lang.String infixToPostfix​(java.lang.String expression)
      Takes a symbolic/numeric infix expression as input and converts it to postfix notation. There is no assumption on spaces between terms or the length of the term (e.g., two digits symbolic or numeric term) it may throw RuntimeException if the input expression is wrong-formed or if it is null
      Specified by:
      infixToPostfix in interface IExpressionEvaluator
      Parameters:
      expression - infix expression
      Returns:
      postfix expression

    • checkVariablesPF

      private boolean checkVariablesPF​(java.lang.String expression)
      Check whether the input postfix expression contains Variables or not such as A or B as these cannot be evaluated
      Parameters:
      expression - postfix expression
      Returns:
      A boolean to determine whether there is a variable in the postfix expression or not

    • checkSpecialCharactersPF

      private boolean checkSpecialCharactersPF​(java.lang.String expression)
      Checks whether the input postfix expression has unwanted characters or not such as $# etc
      Parameters:
      expression - postfix expression
      Returns:
      a boolean to determine whether the expression has unwanted characters or not

    • evaluate

      public int evaluate​(java.lang.String expression)
      Evaluate a postfix numeric expression, with a single space separator it may throw RuntimeException if the input expression is null or if it is wrong-formed it may throw ArithmeticException if there is division by zero
      Specified by:
      evaluate in interface IExpressionEvaluator
      Parameters:
      expression - postfix expression
      Returns:
      the expression evaluated value
